column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

There were approximately 1950 export and 380 young cattle penned representing a decrease of 810 head week-on-week. The usual buying group was present and operating in a dearer market. Quality was good with much of the supply decline coming from the cow pens. Trade cattle lifted 5c to 10c/kg and more for feeder lots. Grown steers and bullocks gained 15c/kg. Heavy grown heifers showing good finish sold 8c/kg dearer. Manufacturing steers improved 10c to 20c/kg. Cows sold 15c to 20c/kg dearer. Heavy bulls gained 5c to 10c/kg. 

Vealers sold from 310c to 405c/kg. Yearling trade steers made between 340c and 380c/kg. Yearling heifers to the trade sold between 315c and 370c/kg. Grown steers made from 340c to 375c/kg. Bullocks sold from 348c to 410c/kg. Heavy grown heifers made between 318c and 371c/kg. 

Heavy Friesian manufacturing steers sold between 290c and 326c with the crossbred portion between 312c and 389c/kg. Most light and medium weight cows made from 217c to 270c/kg. Heavy weight cows sold mostly from 248c to 318c/kg. Heavy bulls made between 271c and 348c/kg. 

Market reporter: Brendan Fletcher.
